title: Man arrested for murder in Scott County
content:
STAMPING GROUND, Ky. (WKYT) - Kentucky State Police is investigating a homicide that happened early Saturday morning in Scott County.
Police were called around 5 a.m. Saturday to Parkers Mobile Home Park in Stamping Ground, where they say a 15-year-old girl was shot in the neck in a home. She was pronounced dead at the scene.
Police have not released the name of the girl, but family members tell WKYT her name is Morgan Penn. Family members tell us Penn did not live in the area. They say she was there with several other people for a sleepover.
Kentucky State Police say they have charged Michael Davidson, 27, with Penn's murder. Troopers say Georgetown Police spotted Davidson's vehicle and attempted to pull him over. Police say Davidson did not stop and they chased him into Franklin County.
Davidson was arrested at the Capital Mobile Home Park in Franklin County. Davidson is charged with murder. Troopers say other charges are pending.
"Our whole family is very tight knit," said Brittany Hensley, a cousin to Penn. "They're all concerned for the well-being of her parents."
Hensley says Penn always had a smile on her face and was a very talented singer.
"She was a good kid," Hensley said. "She was just a teenager who loved to sing while her dad played the guitar."
A fund will be set up at United Bank for Penn's funeral costs. A Gofundme account has also been set up.
"This is a family that is definitely in need of some help during this hard time," said Hensley. "If you have a big heart, just help them out. It would be greatly appreciated."
Tucker-Yocum and Wilson Funeral Home in Georgetown will be handling Penn's funeral arrangements.
